metadata.title: CVE-2019-9797 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
Cross-origin images can be read in violation of the same-origin policy by exporting an image after using createImageBitmap to read the image and then rendering the resulting bitmap image within a canvas element. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 66.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9797` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '66.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3').
